alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Fayette; Harrison; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 12:00PM EDT until August 07 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT...NORTHWESTERN BOURBON...NORTH CENTRAL FAYETTE AND SOUTH CENTRAL HARRISON COUNTIES... At 1200 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Paris, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Paris, Newtown, Currentsville, Shawhan, Ewalt Crossroads, Brentsville, Loradale, Georgetown Scott County Airport, Leesburg and Kiserton. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central Kentucky. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
